intro: Spilanthes ecliptoides, commonly known as the Indian mustards or stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to the warm temperate and tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy, branched stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from summer to autumn. It is known for its strong, pungent odor, which is often described as similar to that of mustard or garlic. Spilanthes ecliptoides is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
